The amniotic sac
Inside the uterus, the baby 
floats	in	a	bag	of	fluid	
called the amniotic sac. 
Before or during labour 
the sac, or ‘membranes’, 
break	and	the	fluid	drains	
out. This is known as the 
‘waters breaking’.
